member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Common.IConnection.CreateSession(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates the session.
member.param: if set to true the session has transaction semantcis.

Indicates whether and how the consumer is to acknowledge received messages. This version of CreateSession accepts an integer value associated with the acknowledge mode described by a Session member and should only be used for backward compatibility. This parameter is ignored if the session is transacted.
member.returns: A newly created session.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Common.IConnection.CreateSession(System.Boolean,TIBCO.EMS.SessionMode)
member.summary: Creates the session.
member.param: if set to true [transacted].

The acknowledge mode. When true, the new session has transaction semantics. Indicates whether and how the consumer is to acknowledge received messages. Legal values are listed under SessionMode. This parameter is ignored if the session is transacted.
member.returns: A newly created session.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.CachingConnectionFactory
member.summary: subclass that adds Session, MessageProducer, and MessageConsumer caching. This ConnectionFactory also switches the ReconnectOnException property to true by default, allowing for automatic recovery of the underlying Connection.
member.remarks:
By default, only one single Session will be cached, with further requested Sessions being created and disposed on demand. Consider raising the SessionCacheSize property in case of a high-concurrency environment.
NOTE: This ConnectionFactory requires explicit closing of all Sessions obtained from its shared Connection. This is the usual recommendation for native EMS access code anyway. However, with this ConnectionFactory, its use is mandatory in order to actually allow for Session reuse.
Note also that MessageConsumers obtained from a cached Session won't get closed until the Session will eventually be removed from the pool. This may lead to semantic side effects in some cases. For a durable subscriber, the logical Session.Close() call will also close the subscription. Re-registering a durable consumer for the same subscription on the same Session handle is not supported; close and reobtain a cached Session first.
member.author: Juergen Hoeller
Mark Pollack (.NET)

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.SingleConnectionFactory
member.summary: A ConnectionFactory adapter that returns the same Connection from all CreateConnection() calls, and ignores calls to Connection.Close(). According to the JMS Connection model, this is perfectly thread-safe. The shared Connection can be automatically recovered in case of an Exception.

remarks.para: You can either pass in a specific Connection directly or let this factory lazily create a Connection via a given target ConnectionFactory.

Useful for testing and in applications when you want to keep using the same Connection for multiple calls, without having a pooling ConnectionFactory underneath. This may span any number of transactions, even concurrently executing transactions.

Note that Spring's message listener containers support the use of a shared Connection within each listener container instance. Using SingleConnectionFactory with a MessageListenerContainer only really makes sense for sharing a single Connection across multiple listener containers.

member.author: Juergen Hoeller
Mark Pollack
Mark Pollack (.NET)

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.SingleConnectionFactory.ReconnectOnException
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the single Connection should be reset (to be subsequently renewed) when a EMSException is reported by the underlying Connection.
member.remarks:
Default is false. Switch this to true to automatically trigger recover based on your messaging provider's exception notifications.
Internally, this will lead to a special ExceptionListener (this SingleConnectionFactory itself) being registered with the underlying Connection. This can also be combined with a user-specified ExceptionListener, if desired.
member.value: true attempt to reconnect on exception during next access; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.CachingConnectionFactory.SessionCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the session cache.
member.remarks:
This cache size is the maximum limit for the number of cached Sessions per session acknowledgement type (auto, client, dups_ok, transacted). As a consequence, the actual number of cached Sessions may be up to four times as high as the specified value - in the unlikely case of mixing and matching different acknowledgement types.
Default is 1: caching a single Session, (re-)creating further ones on demand. Specify a number like 10 if you'd like to raise the number of cached Sessions; that said, 1 may be sufficient for low-concurrency scenarios.
member.value: The size of the session cache.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.CachingConnectionFactory.CacheProducers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cache MessageProducers per Session instance. (more specifically: one MessageProducer per Destination and Session).

remarks.para: Default is "true". Switch this to "false" in order to always, recreate MessageProducers on demand.

member.value: true if should cache message producers; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.CachingConnectionFactory.CacheConsumers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether o cache JMS MessageConsumers per EMS Session instance.
member.remarks:
Mmore specifically: one MessageConsumer per Destination, selector String and Session. Note that durable subscribers will only be cached until logical closing of the Session handle.
Default is "true". Switch this to "false" in order to always recreate MessageConsumers on demand.
member.value: true to cache consumers per session instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.CachingConnectionFactory.IsActive

member.value: true if this instance is active; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.EmsTransactionManager
member.summary: A implementation for a single EMS ConnectionFactory. Binds a Connection/Session pair from the specified ConnecctionFactory to the thread, potentially allowing for one thread-bound Session per ConnectionFactory.

remarks.para: Application code is required to retrieve the transactional Session via . Spring's will autodetect a thread-bound Session and automatically participate in it.

Transaction synchronization is turned off by default, as this manager might be used alongside an IDbProvider based Spring transaction manager such as the AdoPlatformTransactionManager, which has stronger needs for synchronization.

member.author: Juergen Hoeller
Mark Pollack (.NET)

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Connections.EmsTransactionManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks:
The ConnectionFactory has to be set before using the instance. This constructor can be used to prepare a EmsTemplate via a ApplicationContext, typically setting the ConnectionFactory via ConnectionFactory property.
Turns off transaction synchronization by default, as this manager might be used alongside a dbprovider-based Spring transaction manager like AdoPlatformTransactionManager, which has stronger needs for synchronization. Only one manager is allowed to drive synchronization at any point of time.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate
member.summary: Helper class that simplifies EMS access code.

remarks.para: If you want to use dynamic destination creation, you must specify the type of EMS destination to create, using the "pubSubDomain" property. For other operations, this is not necessary. Point-to-Point (Queues) is the default domain.
Default settings for EMS Sessions is "auto-acknowledge".
This template uses a DynamicDestinationResolver and a SimpleMessageConverter as default strategies for resolving a destination name or converting a message, respectively.

member.author: Mark Pollack
Juergen Hoeller
Mark Pollack (.NET)

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Support.EmsAccessor.SessionTransacted
member.summary: Set the transaction mode that is used when creating a EMS Session. Default is "false".

remarks.para: Setting this flag to "true" will use a short local EMS transaction when running outside of a managed transaction, and a synchronized local EMS transaction in case of a managed transaction being present. The latter has the effect of a local EMS transaction being managed alongside the main transaction (which might be a native ADO.NET transaction), with the EMS transaction committing right after the main transaction.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.IEmsOperations.Receive
member.summary:
Receive a message synchronously from the default destination, but only wait up to a specified time for delivery.
This method should be used carefully, since it will block the thread until the message becomes available or until the timeout value is exceeded.
This will only work with a default destination specified!
member.returns: the message received by the consumer, or null if the timeout expires
member.exception: If there is any problem accessing the EMS API

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.IEmsOperations.Receive(TIBCO.EMS.Destination)
member.summary:

member.param: the destination to receive a message from
member.returns: the message received by the consumer, or null if the timeout expires
member.exception: If there is any problem accessing the EMS API

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new EmsTemplate.

remarks.para: Note: The ConnectionFactory has to be set before using the instance. This constructor can be used to prepare a EmsTemplate via an ObjectFactory, typically setting the ConnectionFactory.

member.summary: Create a new EmsTemplate, given a ConnectionFactory.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.InitDefaultStrategies
member.summary: Initialize the default implementations for the template's strategies: DynamicDestinationResolver and SimpleMessageConverter.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.Execute(Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.ISessionCallback,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Execute the action specified by the given action object within a EMS Session.
member.remarks:
Generalized version of execute(SessionCallback), allowing the EMS Connection to be started on the fly.
Use execute(SessionCallback) for the general case. Starting the EMS Connection is just necessary for receiving messages, which is preferably achieved through the receive methods.
member.param: callback object that exposes the session
Start the connection before performing callback action.
member.returns: the result object from working with the session
member.exception: If there is any problem accessing the EMS API

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.Execute(Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.SessionDelegate,System.Boolean)

Use execute(SessionCallback) for the general case. Starting the EMS Connection is just necessary for receiving messages, which is preferably achieved through the receive methods.
member.param: callback object that exposes the session
Start the connection before performing callback action.
member.returns: the result object from working with the session
member.exception: If there is any problem accessing the EMS API

Create a EMS MessageProducer for the given Session and Destination, configuring it to disable message ids and/or timestamps (if necessary).
Delegates to doCreateProducer for creation of the raw EMS MessageProducer
member.param: the EMS Session to create a MessageProducer for
the EMS Destination to create a MessageProducer for
member.returns: the new EMS MessageProducer
member.exception: If there is any problem accessing the EMS API

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.IsSessionLocallyTransacted(Spring.Messaging.Ems.Common.ISession)
member.summary: Determines whether the given Session is locally transacted, that is, whether its transaction is managed by this template class's Session handling and not by an external transaction coordinator.
member.remarks: The Session's own transacted flag will already have been checked before. This method is about finding out whether the Session's transaction is local or externally coordinated.
member.param: The session to check.
member.returns: true if the session is locally transacted; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.DoCreateProducer(Spring.Messaging.Ems.Common.ISession,TIBCO.EMS.Destination)
member.summary: Create a raw EMS MessageProducer for the given Session and Destination.
member.remarks: If CacheJmsResource is true, then the producer will be created upon the first invocation and will retrun the same producer (per destination) on all subsequent calls.
member.param: the EMS Session to create a MessageProducer for
the EMS Destination to create a MessageProducer for
member.returns: the new EMS MessageProducer
member.exception: If there is any problem accessing the EMS API

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.Receive
member.summary:
Receive a message synchronously from the default destination, but only wait up to a specified time for delivery.
This method should be used carefully, since it will block the thread until the message becomes available or until the timeout value is exceeded.
This will only work with a default destination specified!
member.returns: the message received by the consumer, or null if the timeout expires
member.exception: If there is any problem accessing the EMS API

member.returns: the message received by the consumer, or null if the timeout expires
member.exception: If there is any problem accessing the EMS API

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.DefaultDestination
member.summary: Gets or sets the default destination to be used on send/receive operations that do not have a destination parameter.
member.remarks: Alternatively, specify a "defaultDestinationName", to be dynamically resolved via the DestinationResolver.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.DefaultDestinationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the default destination name to be used on send/receive operations that do not have a destination parameter.
member.remarks: Alternatively, specify a EMS Destination object as "DefaultDestination"
member.value: The name of the default destination.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.MessageConverter
member.summary: Gets or sets the message converter for this template.
member.remarks:
Used to resolve Object parameters to convertAndSend methods and Object results from receiveAndConvert methods.
The default converter is a SimpleMessageConverter, which is able to handle BytesMessages, TextMessages and ObjectMessages.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.MessageIdEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Message Ids are enabled.
member.value: true if message id enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.MessageTimestampEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether message timestamps are enabled.
member.value: true if [message timestamp enabled]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.PubSubNoLocal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to inhibit the delivery of messages published by its own connection.
member.value: true if inhibit the delivery of messages published by its own connection; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.ReceiveTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the receive timeout to use for recieve calls.
member.remarks: The default is -1, which means no timeout.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.ExplicitQosEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use explicit Quality of Service values.
member.remarks: If "true", then the values of deliveryMode, priority, and timeToLive will be used when sending a message. Otherwise, the default values, that may be set administratively, will be used
member.value: true if use explicit QoS values; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.DeliveryMode
member.summary: Sets a value indicating the delivery mode QOS
member.remarks: This will set the delivery to persistent, non-persistent, or reliable delivery. Default value is Message.DEFAULT_DELIVERY_MODE (aka TIBCO.EMS.DeliveryMode.PERSISTENT)
member.value: Integer value representing the delivery mode [delivery persistent]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority when sending.
member.remarks: Since a default value may be defined administratively, this is only used when "isExplicitQosEnabled" equals "true".

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.TimeToLive
member.summary: Gets or sets the time to live when sending
member.remarks: Since a default value may be defined administratively, this is only used when "isExplicitQosEnabled" equals "true".

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.EmsTemplate.EmsTemplateResourceFactory
member.summary: ResourceFactory implementation that delegates to this template's callback methods.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.ISessionCallback
member.summary: Callback for executing any number of operations on a provided Session

member.returns: a result object from working with the Session, if any (so can be null)
member.throws: EMSException if there is any problem

member.throws: EMSException if thrown by EMS API methods

Mark Pollack (.NET)

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.IMessagePostProcessor
member.summary: To be used with EmsTemplate's send method that convert an object to a message.

member.author: Mark Pollack

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.IMessagePostProcessor.PostProcessMessage(TIBCO.EMS.Message)

member.returns: the modified version of the Message
member.throws: EMSException if thrown by EMS API methods

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.IProducerCallback

The typical implementation will perform multiple operations on the supplied EMS Session and MessageProducer.

member.author: Mark Pollack

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Core.IProducerCallback.DoInEms(Spring.Messaging.Ems.Common.ISession,Spring.Messaging.Ems.Common.IMessageProducer)

member.throws: EMSException if thrown by EMS API methods

member.summary: Delegate that is used with EmsTemplate's ConvertAndSend method that converts an object.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.SubscriptionDurable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the subscription is durable.
member.remarks:
Set whether to make the subscription durable. The durable subscription name to be used can be specified through the "DurableSubscriptionName" property.
Default is "false". Set this to "true" to register a durable subscription, typically in combination with a "DurableSubscriptionName" value (unless your message listener class name is good enough as subscription name).
Only makes sense when listening to a topic (pub-sub domain).
member.value: true if the subscription is durable; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.DurableSubscriptionName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the durable subscription to create.
member.remarks:
To be applied in case of a topic (pub-sub domain) with subscription durability activated. The durable subscription name needs to be unique within this client's client id. Default is the class name of the specified message listener.
Note: Only 1 concurrent consumer (which is the default of this message listener container) is allowed for each durable subscription.
member.value: The name of the durable subscription.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.ExceptionListener
member.summary: Gets or sets the exception listener to notify in case of a EMSException thrown by the registered message listener or the invocation infrastructure.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.ErrorHandler
member.summary: Sets an ErrorHandler to be invoked in case of any uncaught exceptions thrown while processing a Message. By default there will be no ErrorHandler so that error-level logging is the only result.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.ExposeListenerSession
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to expose listener session to a registered as well as to calls.
member.remarks:
Default is "true", reusing the listener's Session. Turn this off to expose a fresh Session fetched from the same underlying Connection instead, which might be necessary on some messaging providers.
Note that Sessions managed by an external transaction manager will always get exposed to calls. So in terms of EmsTemplate exposure, this setting only affects locally transacted Sessions.
member.value: true if expose listener session; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer.AcceptMessagesWhileStopping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to accept messages while the listener container is in the process of stopping.

remarks.para: Return whether to accept received messages while the listener container receive attempt. Switch this flag on to fully process such messages even in the stopping phase, with the drawback that even newly sent messages might still get processed (if coming in before all receive timeouts have expired).

Aborting receive attempts for such incoming messages might lead to the provider's retry count decreasing for the affected messages. If you have a high number of concurrent consumers, make sure that the number of retries is higher than the number of consumers, to be on the safe side for all potential stopping scenarios.

member.value: true if accept messages while in the process of stopping; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.MessageRejectedWhileStoppingException

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.Adapter.MessageListenerAdapter
member.summary: Message listener adapter that delegates the handling of messages to target listener methods via reflection, with flexible message type conversion. Allows listener methods to operate on message content types, completely independent from the EMS API.

remarks.para: By default, the content of incoming messages gets extracted before being passed into the target listener method, to let the target method operate on message content types such as String or byte array instead of the raw Message. Message type conversion is delegated to a Spring . By default, a will be used. (If you do not want such automatic message conversion taking place, then be sure to set the property to null.)

If a target listener method returns a non-null object (typically of a message content type such as String or byte array), it will get wrapped in a EMS Message and sent to the response destination (either the EMS "reply-to" destination or the specified.

The sending of response messages is only available when using the entry point (typically through a Spring message listener container). Usage as standard EMS MessageListener does not support the generation of response messages.
Consult the reference documentation for examples of method signatures compliant with this adapter class.

member.author: Juergen Hoeller
Mark Pollack (.NET)

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.ISessionAwareMessageListener
member.summary: Variant of the standard EMS MessageListener interface, offering not only the received Message but also the underlying Session object. The latter can be used to send reply messages, without the need to access an external Connection/Session, i.e. without the need to access the underlying ConnectionFactory.
member.remarks: Supported by Spring's as direct alternative to the standard MessageListener interface.
member.author: Juergen Hoeller

member.summary: Gets or sets the handler object to delegate message listening to.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.Adapter.MessageListenerAdapter.DefaultHandlerMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the default handler method to delegate to, for the case where no specific listener method has been determined. Out-of-the-box value is ("HandleMessage"}.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.Adapter.MessageListenerAdapter.DefaultResponseDestination
member.summary:
Sets the default destination to send response messages to. This will be applied in case of a request message that does not carry a "JMSReplyTo" field. Response destinations are only relevant for listener methods that return result objects, which will be wrapped in a response message and sent to a response destination.
Alternatively, specify a "DefaultResponseQueueName" or "DefaultResponseTopicName", to be dynamically resolved via the DestinationResolver.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.Adapter.MessageListenerAdapter.DefaultResponseQueueName
member.summary:
Sets the name of the default response queue to send response messages to. This will be applied in case of a request message that does not carry a "EMSReplyTo" field.
Alternatively, specify a JMS Destination object as "defaultResponseDestination".
member.value: The name of the default response destination queue.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.Adapter.MessageListenerAdapter.DefaultResponseTopicName
member.summary:
Sets the name of the default response topic to send response messages to. This will be applied in case of a request message that does not carry a "ReplyTo" field.
Alternatively, specify a JMS Destination object as "defaultResponseDestination".
member.value: The name of the default response destination topic.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.Adapter.MessageListenerAdapter.DestinationResolver
member.summary:
Gets or sets the destination resolver that should be used to resolve response destination names for this adapter.
The default resolver is a . Specify another implementation, for other strategies, perhaps from a directory service.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.Adapter.MessageListenerAdapter.MessageConverter
member.summary: Gets or sets the message converter that will convert incoming JMS messages to listener method arguments, and objects returned from listener methods back to EMS messages.

remarks.para: The default converter is a {@link SimpleMessageConverter}, which is able to handle BytesMessages}, TextMessages, MapMessages, and ObjectMessages.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.RefreshConnectionUntilSuccessful
member.summary: Refresh the underlying Connection, not returning before an attempt has been successful. Called in case of a shared Connection as well as without shared Connection, so either needs to operate on the shared Connection or on a temporary Connection that just gets established for validation purposes.
member.remarks: The default implementation retries until it successfully established a Connection, for as long as this message listener container is active. Applies the specified recovery interval between retries.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.PubSubNoLocal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to inhibit the delivery of messages published by its own connection. Default is "false".
member.value: true if should inhibit the delivery of messages published by its own connection; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.ConcurrentConsumers
member.summary: Specify the number of concurrent consumers to create. Default is 1.
member.remarks:
Raising the number of concurrent consumers is recommendable in order to scale the consumption of messages coming in from a queue. However, note that any ordering guarantees are lost once multiple consumers are registered. In general, stick with 1 consumer for low-volume queues.
Do not raise the number of concurrent consumers for a topic. This would lead to concurrent consumption of the same message, which is hardly ever desirable.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.RecoveryInterval
member.summary: Sets the time interval between connection recovery attempts. The default is 5 seconds.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Ems.Listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer.MaxRecoveryTime
member.summary: Sets the max recovery time to try reconnection attempts. The default is 10 minutes.

member.summary: Always use a shared EMS connection
